BlenderSetup

From Peragro Tempus Wiki

Contents

  • 1 Blender2Crystal
    • 1.1 Shaders
    • 1.2 Testing
    • 1.3 Problems

Blender2Crystal

You need $CRYSTAL environment variable to point to the built CrystalSpace sources (mine are version 1.3).

Shaders

Put them into "$CRYSTAL/data/shader".

Testing

Export to a .zip file and run "$CRYSTAL/walktest world.zip". You should then be able to walk your scene.

Problems

If you get errors like the following when you try to test the exported map with CS walktest, it may be due to outdated Blender2Crystal plugin. You may then want to try SVN HEAD revision from [1]. Under Ubuntu 7.04 I just copied the contents in the scripts dir into /usr/lib/blender/scripts and did a "rm -rf ~/.blender". My blender version was 2.44. 

crystalspace.maploader.parse.mesh:
  <polymesh> is deprecated. Use <trimesh> instead.
  [node: world,sector(name=exterior),meshobj(name=clouds),polymesh]

crystalspace.maploader.parse.trimesh:
  <shadows> is deprecated. Use <id>shadows</id> instead.
  [node: world,sector(name=exterior),meshobj(name=clouds),polymesh,shadows]

crystalspace.maploader.parse.mesh:
  <polymesh> is deprecated. Use <trimesh> instead.
  [node: world,sector(name=exterior),meshobj(name=Plane.002),polymesh]

crystalspace.maploader.parse.trimesh:
  <shadows> is deprecated. Use <id>shadows</id> instead.
  [node: world,sector(name=exterior),meshobj(name=Plane.002),polymesh,shadows]

crystalspace.maploader.parse.mesh:
  <polymesh> is deprecated. Use <trimesh> instead.
  [node: world,sector(name=exterior),meshobj(name=sky),polymesh]

crystalspace.maploader.parse.trimesh:
  <shadows> is deprecated. Use <id>shadows</id> instead.
  [node: world,sector(name=exterior),meshobj(name=sky),polymesh,shadows]
